WRITING.TITLE: "If you're a libertarian Donald Trump voter, you're the most misinformed voting class in America."

WRITING.TEXT: Indeed, I posted it there first: https://www.reddit.com/r/LateStageCapitalism/comments/5wb81j/tech_and_the_fake_market_tactic_in_one_generation/

Future generations will be more savvy. Like my granddaughter. She just sent me a snapchat.
I bet she's great with 'the cyber'.
I don't hear 'crying', I hear valid criticism about lack of regulation and awareness towards those areas where these stockholder interests don't align with society at large.

It spreads whatever people want to spread on it.
Technology is merely a multiplier and enabler of human traits and behaviours.
**[Amazon has an overwhelming market share lead](http://sc.cnbcfm.com/applications/cnbc.com/resources/files/2016/12/23/onlinemarket.jpg)**

That's what the author says.
These pseudo-market patterns also mask patterns of subsidy, like the fact that Ubers current operations are subsidized by investors to the tune of $2 billion per year. Thats a cost that will be immediately passed along to consumers as soon as Uber succeeds in displacing conventional taxis.
(...)
Just as Uber subsidizes fares during the phase when theyre displacing regulated taxis, Facebook subsidizes publishers ad rates during the phase when theyre displacing third-party advertising networks.
The internet has never been more centralised around Facebook, Google and Amazon as it is now.

I don't think the problem is with startups, who indeed would be harmed by regulations requiring *'millions in capital to even be able to legally run a company in the sector'*.
I do however think that companies in systemically critical market positions like Facebook, Amazon and Google could and should be regulated a lot more thoroughly against anti-competitive practices such as the ones described in the article.
However I also fully agree that decentralised blockchain-based technologies could partially help with issues like this. The crux of the problem isn't technological though, it's economic/political/social/cultural. Even the best and most decentralised protocols don't solve the problem as long as we continuously give up our freedoms (often unknowingly) for a bit more convenience and *'better user experience.'*

WRITING.TITLE: Tech and the Fake Market tactic

Subtle.
How are secret algorithms in a black box more transparent than a taxi driver taking a long route?

WRITING.TITLE: Tech and the Fake Market tactic
Tech and the Fake Market tactic

A Reddit clone where in order to comment, users have to first answer an easy question about the article's content (defined by OP as part of post submission process) to make sure they've actually read it
In one generation, the Internet went from opening up new free markets to creating a series of Fake Markets that exploit society, without most media or politicians even noticing.

Tech and the Fake Market tactic: In one generation, the Internet went from opening up new free markets to creating a series of Fake Markets that exploit society, without most media or politicians even noticing.

WRITING.TEXT:
Let's use the biggest film of the decade as an example. Now it's not a sequel, remix or adaptation, but it is a genre film -- sci-fi -- and most tellingly, it's a member of a tiny sub-genre where sympathetic white people feel bad about all the murder, pillaging, and annihilation being done on their behalf.
I call this sub-genre "Sorry about Colonialism!" I'm talking about movies like Dances With Wolves, The Last Samurai, The Last of the Mohicans, Dune, Lawrence of Arabia, A Man Called Horse, and even Fern Gully and Pocahontas.
* **[Everything is a Remix Part 2](https://youtu.be/Z-HuenDPZw0?t=2m17s)**
I really enjoyed the film and watched it many times. But it *is* very much a stereotype at this point.

The full 24-minute documentary can be watched here:
http://www.fresnobee.com/news/nation-world/national/article128729769.html

What makes someone a scientist exactly?
I think the concept of *'being an X'* is fallacious, reductive and unhelpful.
It **[doesn't help the person identifying as X](http://paulgraham.com/identity.html)** and for most X it doesn't help others make meaningful assumptions about that person referred to as an X beyond the most basic level of nuance and differentiation.

Fuck this shit.

Also, the soviets and other communist striving societies glorified war, a lot.

WRITING.TEXT: Genau solche Infos wollte ich wissen. Gibt es hierfr irgendwelche Artikel/Berichte/Belege, die die Gesetzsprechungspraxis in Deutschland beispielhaft belegen?

Das sind die absolut grundlegenden Basics der gesetzlichen Theorie. Ich wollte mehr ber die Praxis und Beispiele mit genaueren Details wissen.
Laut Gesetz hier kann der Vermieter einen Mieter problemlos rausschmeien, sobald der mehr als zwei Monate mit der Miete im Verzug ist. Das deckt sich nicht wirklich mit den Behauptungen, es sei in der Praxis viel schwieriger fr Vermieter, mit solchen Mietern zu verfahren.

I didn't say automation is *good* or *bad*.
Just what its effects will be.

WRITING.TITLE: Ich hre oft, in Deutschland machen Mieterschutzgesetze es Vermietern besonders schwer, gegen Mieter vorzugehen. In welchen Fllen ist das zum Beispiel so?
WRITING.TEXT:
Kennt jemand Beispiele dafr, wie in Deutschland Mieter durch Mieterschutzgesetze strker geschtzt sind als in anderen vergleichbaren Lndern?
Und in welchen Fllen es fr Vermieter besonders (womglich unangemessen) schwierig ist, gegen problematische Mieter vorzugehen?
Ich hre oft, dass die Mieterschtuzgesetze in Deutschland dafr verantwortlich sind, dass Vermieter hier eine *enorme* Sicherheit erwarten bevor sie einen Mietvertrag unterschreiben - also mehr Vermgen, sicherere Arbeitsvertrge/Einkommensquellen, am besten auch Familie, etc. auf Seite des Mieters, als sie es in anderen Lndern ohne deutsche Mieterschutzgesetze tun wrden.
Denn wenn in Deutschland mal ein Mieter sumig wird mit der Miete, ist es angeblich absurd schwierig, ihn loszuwerden um keinen Mietverlust erleiden zu mssen.
Wei jemand hier, wie die Lage tatschlich ist? Wenn ich als Mieter meine Miete nicht mehr bezahlen knnte oder wollte, was wrde das passieren? (Nicht, dass ich das vorhabe - bin seit 7 Jahren ohne Probleme in der gleichen Wohnung. Frage aus reinem Interesse.)

Automation will cost much more jobs in a much shorter time frame than can be compensated by a decrease in world population. And in actual fact the world population isn't decreasing at all but still rapidly growing.

Population growth is being driven by the developing world, but birth rates are going down dramatically with development there, as well.
**[Not as dramatically as one would hope.](https://i.imgur.com/Lde9KSI.jpg)**

Same problem here as well.
I just unplug the cable and let it run on battery when it disturbs me. Supposedly keeping the battery between 50% and 80% is better for its longevity than keeping it at 100% all the time anyway.

However, if I start a video file from the SSD the sound is the proper volume. What's up with that?
Chrome is at 100% in the Volume Mixer.

I made a few **[videos](https://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?395328-A-MODO-artist-learns-Blender-Newest-video-7-Parenting)** comparing MODO and Blender (and Maya).

They look fantastic and super-useful!
People who think UI design is *unnecessary fluff* don't understand usability and efficiency.
The moral is to not compare.

WRITING.TITLE: What technologies/languages are used to create a cross-platform desktop application like Affinity Designer?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been wondering - does anyone know what technologies are involved in creating a desktop app such as **[Affinity Designer](https://affinity.serif.com/en-gb/designer/)**?
Which languages does one have to know?
What knowledge is necessary?
I presume that for example the image manipulation / vector graphics tools require mostly Linear Algebra?
What languages would this be written in? What frameworks would be used?
Just trying to get a better overview of the world of professional software development in a variety of settings and applications.

Wei nicht ob 'bayerisch' aber frnkisch schon (ich komme aus Franken). Insbesondere Pnktlichkeit ist ein groes Ding.
Unpnktlichkeit wird definitiv als Mangel an Respekt, Rcksicht oder Zuverlssigkeit interpretiert.
Das merke ich bei mir selbst noch immer... habe das Gefhl, ich sei der einzige in Berlin, der immer pnktlich ist - und muss dann immer auf andere warten. Das strt mich dann doch immer etwas, auch wenn ich stets versuche, mir meiner Konditionierung bewusst sein sein und keine bswilligen Absichten oder mangelnde Wertschtzung auf die andere Person zu projizieren. ;)

The full lists also includes Starbucks and L'OREAL:
http://worldsmostethicalcompanies.ethisphere.com/honorees/
http://www.forbes.com/sites/karstenstrauss/2016/03/09/the-worlds-most-ethical-companies-2016/#2e60086c73dc
Not only do companies self-nominate themselves, they also pay $1500 for their nomination.
Complete and utter bullshit.

WRITING.TITLE: H M named as one of the world's most ethical companies in 2016

WRITING.TEXT:
Schner Gedanke, aber leider funktioniert das so nicht.
Fleischessen - selbst lokales - ist weitaus ressourcenfeindlicher als vegetarische/vegane Ernhrung. Nutztiere fressen tonnenweise Futtermittel, die zum berwiegenden Groteil in Sdamerika und Asien angebaut werden, und zu massiven Regenwaldrodungen fhren.
Keine Frage: Lokales Obst essen statt sich tglich mit Mangos und Ananas zu sttigen, ist immer eine gute Idee. Aber wer glaubt, mit Fleischkonsum und Sdlandfruchtverzicht effektiv fr die Umwelt zu engagieren, sollte sich nochmal genauer informieren.
Ich kenne Leute, die ein schlechtes Bild von Berlin haben - aber keineswegs aufgrund irgendeines der von ihm hier gelisteten Punkte.

Bei der Wahl zum Berliner Abgeordnetenhaus zog die AfD in vier von fnf Bohnsdorfer Wahllokalen aus dem Stand an SPD und Linken vorbei
Dass jemand, der in diesem Umfeld aufgewachsen ist, in Bayern und der CSU eher sein Glck findet als in der Berliner Innenstadt, wundert mich wenig.

Die Heimatverbundenheit, das gelebte Brauchtum sowie die soziale und christliche Komponente in der bayerischen Politik empfinde ich als uerst vorbildlich gegenber der CDU.
Kann mir jemand erklren, wo die CSU sozialer und 'christlicher' (in echter Tat, nicht nur im Marketing und Ritualen) ist, als die CDU?
